description: Starting April 23 2020 Mexico State Edomex expanded the “Hoy No Circula” program in an effort to reduce mobility within Mexico State. The "Hoy No Circula" program is a pre-existing program (pre-pandemic times) that aimed to reduce auto emissions by limiting the circulation of vehicles according to a sticker and number on their license plate on specific days, with some exceptions. On April 23, Edomex expanded the program such that the exceptions to the program were removed in an effort to reduce mobility within the state in response to the pandemic.

description:
Beginning April 23, around 20% of Mexico City’s Metro, bus and light rail stations will close. By closing some of the least busy stations, the mayor hopes to ease crowding at busier stations by increasing the frequency of trains and buses. 

Effective June 15, Mexico City has reduced the "Hoy no circula" program that prevents unnecessary vehicular movement during the COVID-19 pandemic.
